summary: This is a scheduling order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It sets deadlines for pretrial disclosures, motions, and other procedures, with a presumptive trial commencement date of July 12, 2021. The order references the S2 indictment and agreements between the parties.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case for which this scheduling order is issued.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the scheduling order for the pretrial proceedings in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Court Conference
events.description: A conference was held where the court considered the defendant's request for a continuance.

events.title: Presumptive Trial Commencement Date
events.description: The court sets a presumptive date for the trial to begin, pending resolution of the defendant's continuance request.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The court issued a detailed pretrial schedule for the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The schedule is based on a presumptive trial commencement date of July 12, 2021, subject to a pending request for a continuance.
The order references deadlines related to the 'S2 indictment,' indicating superseding charges.
Specific disclosure deadlines are set for expert witnesses, alleged victims, Jencks/Giglio materials, exhibits, and motions in limine.
The parties are ordered to confer and submit a joint letter regarding the timing of defense witness statements under Rule 26.2.
